page.title: 07LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: LOCAL HISTORY Many of the streets north of Manchester Road bear names which originate from Salford rather than Walkden or Little Hulton. This is significant because this area is known as "Salford Overspill". This name originates from 1946 when Salford Corporation attempted to solve its housing shortage by building council property in Little Hulton. The work commenced in October 1948 and by July 1966 4500 houses had been built.The connection of the present community with Salford is shown by the fact that in the present class of eleven year olds at St. Edmunds R.C. Primary School 33%of the children, 55% of their parents and 70% of their grand_parents were born in Salford.
